levels.title: What is Data Science?
levels.description: An overview of the field, its importance, and key concepts.

levels.title: Introduction to Python
levels.description: Learn the syntax and basic features of the Python programming language.

levels.title: Python Data Types and Variables
levels.description: Understand integers, floats, strings, and booleans.

levels.title: Python Lists, Tuples, and Dictionaries
levels.description: Learn to work with Python's core data structures.

levels.title: Python Conditional Statements and Loops
levels.description: Control the flow of your Python programs.

levels.title: Python Functions
levels.description: Write reusable blocks of code in Python.

levels.title: Introduction to NumPy
levels.description: Learn the fundamental package for numerical computation in Python.

levels.title: Creating NumPy Arrays
levels.description: Understand how to create and manipulate N-dimensional arrays.

levels.title: NumPy Array Indexing and Slicing
levels.description: Select and modify subsets of your data efficiently.

levels.title: Introduction to Pandas
levels.description: Discover the powerful data analysis and manipulation library.

levels.title: Pandas Series and DataFrames
levels.description: Learn about the two primary data structures in Pandas.

levels.title: Loading Data with Pandas (CSV)
levels.description: Read data from CSV files into a DataFrame.

levels.title: Exploring a DataFrame
levels.description: Use .head(), .tail(), .info(), and .describe() to inspect data.

levels.title: Introduction to Data Visualization
levels.description: Understand the importance of visualizing data.

levels.title: Introduction to Matplotlib
levels.description: Create your first plots with Python's most popular plotting library.

levels.title: Creating Line and Scatter Plots
levels.description: Visualize trends and relationships in your data.

levels.title: Introduction to Seaborn
levels.description: Learn a high-level interface for drawing attractive statistical graphics.

levels.title: Basic Statistics: Mean, Median, and Mode
levels.description: Understand measures of central tendency.

levels.title: Basic Statistics: Variance and Standard Deviation
levels.description: Understand measures of data spread.

levels.title: What is Machine Learning?
levels.description: A high-level overview of ML concepts.

levels.title: Supervised vs. Unsupervised Learning
levels.description: Understand the two main types of machine learning.

levels.title: Setting up Your Data Science Environment
levels.description: Install Python, Jupyter, and essential libraries.

levels.title: Introduction to Jupyter Notebooks
levels.description: Learn to use the interactive coding environment.

levels.title: NumPy Mathematical Functions
levels.description: Perform element-wise operations on arrays.

levels.title: Pandas Data Selection (loc, iloc)
levels.description: Select rows and columns from a DataFrame.

levels.title: Handling Missing Data in Pandas
levels.description: Learn to find and deal with null values.

levels.title: Pandas GroupBy Operations
levels.description: Split data, apply a function, and combine the results.

levels.title: Creating Bar Plots and Histograms
levels.description: Visualize categorical data and distributions.

levels.title: Probability Basics
levels.description: Understand concepts like events, sample spaces, and probability.

levels.title: Introduction to Linear Algebra
levels.description: Learn about vectors and matrices, the building blocks of ML.

levels.title: Introduction to Calculus
levels.description: Grasp the basics of derivatives and gradients.

levels.title: The Data Science Lifecycle
levels.description: Understand the end-to-end process of a data science project.

levels.title: Data Cleaning and Preparation
levels.description: Learn why clean data is crucial for any analysis.

levels.title: Introduction to Scikit-Learn
levels.description: Get to know the most popular ML library for Python.

levels.title: Your First ML Model: Linear Regression
levels.description: Predict continuous values based on input features.

levels.title: Training and Test Sets
levels.description: Learn how to split your data to evaluate model performance.

levels.title: Evaluating a Regression Model (MSE, R^2)
levels.description: Understand how to measure the accuracy of your model.

levels.title: Data Wrangling: Combining DataFrames
levels.description: Learn to merge, join, and concatenate data.

levels.title: Data Wrangling: Reshaping Data
levels.description: Understand how to pivot and melt DataFrames.

levels.title: Introduction to Classification
levels.description: Learn about models that predict categories.

levels.title: Your First Classifier: Logistic Regression
levels.description: Build a model for binary classification.

levels.title: Evaluating a Classification Model (Accuracy)
levels.description: Measure the performance of a classification model.

levels.title: Git and GitHub for Data Science
levels.description: Version control your code and collaborate on projects.

levels.title: Ethical Considerations in Data Science
levels.description: Understand bias, fairness, and privacy in data.

levels.title: Introduction to SQL
levels.description: Learn the language for querying databases.

levels.title: SQL SELECT and WHERE clauses
levels.description: Retrieve specific data from a database table.

levels.title: Communicating Data Science Results
levels.description: Learn the basics of storytelling with data.

levels.title: Creating a Simple Data Dashboard
levels.description: Build a basic interactive dashboard with a library like Streamlit.

levels.title: What is AI?
levels.description: Differentiate between AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning.

levels.title: Introduction to Neural Networks
levels.description: Understand the basic structure of a neural network.

levels.title: Pandas String Operations
levels.description: Work with text data in your DataFrames.

levels.title: Pandas Datetime Operations
levels.description: Handle time-series data effectively.

levels.title: Customizing Matplotlib Plots
levels.description: Add titles, labels, and legends to your charts.

levels.title: Introduction to Plotly
levels.description: Create interactive, D3.js-based visualizations.

levels.title: Correlation vs. Causation
levels.description: Understand this fundamental concept in statistics.

levels.title: SQL Joins (INNER, LEFT)
levels.description: Combine data from multiple tables in SQL.

levels.title: SQL Aggregate Functions (COUNT, SUM, AVG)
levels.description: Perform calculations on groups of data.

levels.title: Introduction to Feature Engineering
levels.description: Understand how to create new features from existing data.

levels.title: Feature Scaling
levels.description: Learn why and how to scale your numerical features.

levels.title: K-Nearest Neighbors Algorithm
levels.description: A simple yet powerful classification algorithm.

levels.title: Understanding Overfitting and Underfitting
levels.description: Learn about this key challenge in machine learning.

levels.title: Introduction to Web Scraping
levels.description: Extract data from websites using libraries like Beautiful Soup.

levels.title: Introduction to APIs
levels.description: Learn how to collect data from web APIs.

levels.title: What is a Generative AI?
levels.description: Understand the basics of models that create new content.

levels.title: What are LLMs (Large Language Models)?
levels.description: A high-level introduction to models like GPT.

levels.title: Introduction to Prompt Engineering
levels.description: Learn how to write effective prompts for LLMs.

levels.title: Basic Python Classes
levels.description: Learn the fundamentals of object-oriented programming in Python.

levels.title: Python Modules and Packages
levels.description: Organize your Python code effectively.

levels.title: Reading Documentation
levels.description: A crucial skill for any data scientist.

levels.title: Project: Analyze a Real-World Dataset
levels.description: Apply your Pandas and Matplotlib skills to explore a dataset.

levels.title: Project: Build a Simple Predictive Model
levels.description: Go through the basic ML workflow on a dataset.

levels.title: Command Line Basics for Data Science
levels.description: Navigate your file system and run scripts from the terminal.

levels.title: Introduction to Virtual Environments
levels.description: Manage project dependencies with venv or conda.

levels.title: Data Cleaning: Handling Duplicates
levels.description: Find and remove duplicate records from your data.

levels.title: Data Cleaning: Correcting Data Types
levels.description: Ensure your columns have the correct data types for analysis.

levels.title: Final Project: Kaggle Competition Intro
levels.description: Enter a beginner-friendly Kaggle competition and make your first submission.

levels.title: Feature Engineering Deep Dive
levels.description: Techniques for creating and selecting impactful features.

levels.title: Categorical Variable Encoding
levels.description: Master one-hot encoding, label encoding, and target encoding.

levels.title: Decision Trees
levels.description: Understand how this interpretable model works for regression and classification.

levels.title: Ensemble Methods: Random Forests
levels.description: Combine multiple decision trees to improve performance.

levels.title: Ensemble Methods: Gradient Boosting (XGBoost, LightGBM)
levels.description: Learn about powerful and popular boosting algorithms.

levels.title: Model Evaluation: Confusion Matrix
levels.description: Understand precision, recall, and F1-score.

levels.title: Model Evaluation: ROC Curve and AUC
levels.description: Visualize and measure the performance of binary classifiers.

levels.title: Cross-Validation
levels.description: A robust method for evaluating model performance.

levels.title: Hyperparameter Tuning: Grid Search
levels.description: Systematically search for the best model parameters.

levels.title: Hyperparameter Tuning: Random Search
levels.description: An efficient alternative to grid search.

levels.title: Unsupervised Learning: K-Means Clustering
levels.description: Group unlabeled data into clusters based on similarity.

levels.title: Unsupervised Learning: Hierarchical Clustering
levels.description: Create a tree of nested clusters.

levels.title: Dimensionality Reduction: PCA
levels.description: Reduce the number of features while preserving important information.

levels.title: Introduction to Deep Learning
levels.description: Understand the concepts behind deep neural networks.

levels.title: Introduction to TensorFlow
levels.description: Learn one of the most popular deep learning frameworks.

levels.title: Introduction to Keras
levels.description: Use a high-level API to build neural networks easily.

levels.title: Building Your First Neural Network
levels.description: Create a simple dense network for a classification task.

levels.title: Activation Functions (ReLU, Sigmoid)
levels.description: Understand their role in neural networks.

levels.title: Optimizers (Adam, SGD) and Loss Functions
levels.description: Learn how neural networks are trained.

levels.title: Introduction to Natural Language Processing (NLP)
levels.description: Teach computers to understand human language.

levels.title: Text Preprocessing: Tokenization and Stop Words
levels.description: Prepare text data for machine learning models.

levels.title: Text Representation: Bag-of-Words
levels.description: A simple way to convert text into numerical features.

levels.title: Text Representation: TF-IDF
levels.description: A more advanced method for text vectorization.

levels.title: Sentiment Analysis
levels.description: Build a model to classify text as positive, negative, or neutral.

levels.title: Introduction to Computer Vision
levels.description: Enable computers to 'see' and interpret images.

levels.title: Image Data Augmentation
levels.description: Increase the size of your training dataset by transforming images.

levels.title: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
levels.description: The workhorse of modern computer vision.

levels.title: Building an Image Classifier with CNNs
levels.description: Train a model to classify images into different categories.

levels.title: Advanced SQL: Window Functions
levels.description: Perform calculations across a set of table rows.

levels.title: Advanced SQL: Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
levels.description: Write more readable and modular SQL queries.

levels.title: Time Series Analysis
levels.description: Analyze and forecast data points indexed in time order.

levels.title: Time Series Decomposition
levels.description: Break down a time series into trend, seasonality, and residuals.

levels.title: Introduction to Recommendation Systems
levels.description: Learn how platforms like Netflix and Amazon recommend items.

levels.title: Collaborative Filtering
levels.description: A common technique for building recommendation systems.

levels.title: A/B Testing Principles
levels.description: Learn how to design and analyze controlled experiments.

levels.title: Statistical Significance (p-values)
levels.description: Understand how to interpret the results of A/B tests.

levels.title: Building Data Pipelines with Airflow
levels.description: Automate your data workflows.

levels.title: Introduction to Big Data: Hadoop and Spark
levels.description: A high-level overview of big data technologies.

levels.title: Introduction to PySpark
levels.description: Use Python with Apache Spark to process large datasets.

levels.title: Deploying ML Models: REST APIs with Flask
levels.description: Make your trained model available as a web service.

levels.title: Containerizing an ML Model with Docker
levels.description: Package your model and its dependencies for easy deployment.

levels.title: Introduction to Cloud Platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)
levels.description: Learn about the data services offered by major cloud providers.

levels.title: Using AWS S3 for Data Storage
levels.description: Store and retrieve data from AWS's object storage service.

levels.title: Training a Model on AWS SageMaker
levels.description: Use a managed service to train and deploy ML models.

levels.title: Support Vector Machines (SVM)
levels.description: Learn about this powerful classification algorithm.

levels.title: Bayesian Methods and Naive Bayes
levels.description: Understand probabilistic approaches to machine learning.

levels.title: Regularization (L1 and L2)
levels.description: A technique to prevent overfitting in linear models.

levels.title: Advanced Visualization with Plotly
levels.description: Create interactive 3D plots and dashboards.

levels.title: Geospatial Data Analysis with GeoPandas
levels.description: Analyze and visualize geographical data.

levels.title: Bayesian Hyperparameter Optimization
levels.description: A smarter way to find the best model parameters.

levels.title: Model Interpretability (SHAP, LIME)
levels.description: Understand why your model makes certain predictions.

levels.title: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
levels.description: A type of neural network designed for sequential data.

levels.title: Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) Networks
levels.description: An advanced RNN architecture for capturing long-term dependencies.

levels.title: Word Embeddings (Word2Vec, GloVe)
levels.description: Represent words as dense vectors.

levels.title: Transfer Learning in Computer Vision
levels.description: Use pre-trained models to boost performance on your tasks.

levels.title: Object Detection (YOLO, Faster R-CNN)
levels.description: Draw bounding boxes around objects in images.

levels.title: Advanced SQL: Subqueries and Temporary Tables
levels.description: Write more complex and efficient queries.

levels.title: SQL Performance Tuning
levels.description: Learn how to use indexes to speed up your queries.

levels.title: Introduction to MLOps
levels.description: Understand the principles of bringing ML models to production.

levels.title: Data Version Control (DVC)
levels.description: Version control your data and models alongside your code.

levels.title: Feature Stores
levels.description: A central place to store, share, and manage features for ML models.

levels.title: Forecasting with ARIMA/SARIMA models
levels.description: Classical statistical methods for time series forecasting.

levels.title: Anomaly Detection
levels.description: Identify unusual patterns that do not conform to expected behavior.

levels.title: Network Analysis with NetworkX
levels.description: Analyze relationships and connections in graph data.

levels.title: Causal Inference
levels.description: Move beyond correlation to understand cause-and-effect relationships.

levels.title: Project: Build a Movie Recommender System
levels.description: Create a system that recommends movies to users.

levels.title: Project: NLP for Fake News Detection
levels.description: Build a classifier to distinguish real news from fake news.

levels.title: Final Project: End-to-End CV Application
levels.description: Build, train, and deploy a computer vision model.

levels.title: Transformers and the Attention Mechanism
levels.description: The architecture behind modern LLMs like GPT and BERT.

levels.title: Fine-Tuning a Pre-trained Transformer Model (BERT)
levels.description: Adapt a large language model for a specific NLP task.

levels.title: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
levels.description: Train two neural networks in a zero-sum game to generate realistic data.

levels.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning
levels.description: Train agents to make optimal decisions in an environment.

levels.title: Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF)
levels.description: The technique used to align large language models.

levels.title: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)
levels.description: Apply deep learning techniques to graph-structured data.

levels.title: ML System Design
levels.description: Architect scalable, reliable, and maintainable machine learning systems.

levels.title: ML Monitoring and Alerting
levels.description: Track model performance in production and detect data drift.

levels.title: Distributed Model Training
levels.description: Train massive models across multiple machines.

levels.title: Model Quantization and Pruning
levels.description: Optimize models for deployment on edge devices.

levels.title: Advanced MLOps: CI/CD/CT for Machine Learning
levels.description: Automate the entire lifecycle of ML models.

levels.title: Building a Feature Store from Scratch
levels.description: Understand the architecture of a feature store.

levels.title: Real-time Machine Learning
levels.description: Build systems that can make predictions with low latency.

levels.title: Large-Scale Data Processing with Spark
levels.description: Optimize Spark jobs for performance and cost.

levels.title: Streaming Data Processing (Kafka, Spark Streaming)
levels.description: Analyze data as it arrives in real-time.

levels.title: Deep Dive into Causality
levels.description: Explore advanced methods like instrumental variables and regression discontinuity.

levels.title: Uplift Modeling
levels.description: Measure the incremental impact of an intervention.

levels.title: Federated Learning
levels.description: Train ML models across decentralized devices without sharing data.

levels.title: Meta-Learning: Learning to Learn
levels.description: Train models that can adapt quickly to new tasks.

levels.title: AutoML
levels.description: Automate the process of applying machine learning.

levels.title: Building RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) Systems
levels.description: Combine LLMs with external knowledge bases.

levels.title: Vector Databases (Pinecone, Weaviate)
levels.description: Store and query high-dimensional vector embeddings.

levels.title: Semantic Search
levels.description: Build search systems that understand the meaning of queries.

levels.title: Multi-Modal Models (CLIP, DALL-E)
levels.description: Work with models that understand both text and images.

levels.title: Ethical AI and AI Alignment
levels.description: Explore the challenges of creating safe and beneficial AI.

levels.title: Image Segmentation
levels.description: Classify every pixel in an image.

levels.title: 3D Computer Vision
levels.description: Work with point clouds and 3D scenes.

levels.title: Self-Supervised Learning
levels.description: Learn representations from unlabeled data.

levels.title: Zero-Shot and Few-Shot Learning
levels.description: Train models to perform tasks with little to no labeled data.

levels.title: Probabilistic Programming (PyMC, Stan)
levels.description: Build and fit Bayesian statistical models.

levels.title: Gaussian Processes
levels.description: A powerful non-parametric method for regression.

levels.title: Advanced Time Series: Deep Learning Models (LSTM, Transformers)
levels.description: Apply deep learning to forecasting.

levels.title: Data Engineering for Data Scientists
levels.description: Understand how to build and maintain data infrastructure.

levels.title: Data Governance and Quality
levels.description: Establish processes for maintaining high-quality data.

levels.title: Building a Data Science Portfolio
levels.description: Showcase your projects and skills to potential employers.

levels.title: Data Science in Production
levels.description: A capstone course on the end-to-end lifecycle.

levels.title: Cracking the Data Science Interview
levels.description: Practice SQL, probability, and modeling questions.

levels.title: Research Paper Implementation
levels.description: Read and implement a recent machine learning paper.

levels.title: Kubernetes for MLOps
levels.description: Deploy and manage ML workloads on Kubernetes.

levels.title: Optimizing LLM Inference
levels.description: Techniques for making LLM predictions faster and cheaper.

levels.title: Fine-Tuning Diffusion Models
levels.description: Customize generative image models.

levels.title: Explainable AI (XAI) Deep Dive
levels.description: Advanced techniques for understanding complex models.

levels.title: Advanced Recommender Systems (Factorization Machines)
levels.description: Learn about state-of-the-art recommender models.

levels.title: Bandit Algorithms
levels.description: A class of algorithms for online decision-making.

levels.title: Survival Analysis
levels.description: Model time-to-event data.

levels.title: Operations Research
levels.description: Use mathematical models to optimize business processes.

levels.title: Leading Data Science Teams
levels.description: Learn about project management and mentorship for data science.

levels.title: Consulting and Communicating with Stakeholders
levels.description: Translate business problems into data science problems.

levels.title: Final Project: Build and Deploy a RAG-based Chatbot
levels.description: Create a chatbot that can answer questions using a custom knowledge base.

levels.title: Final Project: Contribute to an Open Source ML Library
levels.description: Make a meaningful contribution to a library like Scikit-learn or Hugging Face.

levels.title: Final Project: Publish a Kaggle Notebook
levels.description: Create a high-quality, well-documented notebook that gets upvoted.

levels.title: Attention is All You Need - Paper Review
levels.description: Deep dive into the original Transformer paper.

levels.title: BERT - Paper Review
levels.description: Understand the Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers.

levels.title: Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) - Paper Review
levels.description: Study the architecture of the GPT series.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Code Generation
levels.description: Use LLMs to assist in writing and debugging code.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Creative Writing
levels.description: Leverage LLMs for creative and marketing purposes.

levels.title: Evaluating Generative Models
levels.description: Learn metrics and methods for assessing the quality of generated content.

levels.title: Agentic AI Systems
levels.description: Build AI agents that can use tools and reason about complex tasks.

levels.title: AI Safety and Security
levels.description: Understand prompt injection, model poisoning, and other threats.

levels.title: The Business of AI
levels.description: Understand how to build a business case for an AI project.

levels.title: AI Product Management
levels.description: Learn how to manage the lifecycle of an AI product.

levels.title: Quantum Machine Learning
levels.description: An introduction to the intersection of quantum computing and ML.

levels.title: AI for Scientific Discovery
levels.description: Explore how AI is accelerating research in various fields.

levels.title: Topological Data Analysis
levels.description: Analyze the shape of data.

levels.title: Deep Learning on FPGAs and ASICs
levels.description: Optimize models for custom hardware.

levels.title: The Future of AGI
levels.description: Discuss the path towards Artificial General Intelligence.

levels.title: Mock Interview: ML System Design
levels.description: Practice a realistic ML system design interview.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Advanced SQL & Probability
levels.description: Tackle difficult data interview questions.

levels.title: The role of the 'Chief AI Officer'
levels.description: Understand the strategic importance of AI leadership in organizations.

levels.title: Building with the OpenAI API
levels.description: A practical guide to using the OpenAI API for various tasks.

levels.title: Building with the Google AI API (Gemini)
levels.description: A practical guide to using the Gemini API.

levels.title: Building with Anthropic's Claude API
levels.description: A practical guide to using the Claude API.

levels.title: Data-Centric AI
levels.description: Focus on improving data quality rather than just model architecture.

levels.title: Differential Privacy
levels.description: A formal framework for guaranteeing data privacy.

levels.title: Homomorphic Encryption
levels.description: Perform computations on encrypted data.

levels.title: Knowledge Graphs
levels.description: Represent and reason about complex relationships in data.

levels.title: Spiking Neural Networks
levels.description: A more biologically plausible neural network model.

levels.title: Neuro-Symbolic AI
levels.description: Combine the strengths of deep learning and symbolic reasoning.

levels.title: Final Project: Design a novel AI System
levels.description: Propose and architect a novel AI system to solve a real-world problem.

levels.title: Final Project: Win a Kaggle Medal
levels.description: Achieve a bronze, silver, or gold medal in a Kaggle competition.

levels.title: Final Project: Launch an AI-powered Micro-SaaS
levels.description: Build and launch a small, AI-driven software-as-a-service product.

levels.title: Interpreting Model Predictions
levels.description: A deeper look into SHAP and LIME.

levels.title: Advanced Model Blending & Stacking
levels.description: Combine diverse models to achieve SOTA results.

levels.title: Time Series with DeepAR
levels.description: Explore probabilistic forecasting with autoregressive recurrent networks.

levels.title: Automated Feature Engineering
levels.description: Using libraries like Featuretools to automate feature creation.

levels.title: Theil-Sen Estimator for Robust Regression
levels.description: A non-parametric method for robust linear regression.

levels.title: GANs for Tabular Data (TGAN, CTGAN)
levels.description: Generate synthetic tabular data for privacy or augmentation.

levels.title: Deep Active Learning
levels.description: Intelligently query data to be labeled to reduce annotation costs.

levels.title: Conformal Prediction
levels.description: A framework for creating statistically rigorous uncertainty intervals.

levels.title: AI Governance and Regulation
levels.description: Understanding the global landscape of AI laws and policies.

levels.title: Advanced SQL for Big Data (Presto, BigQuery)
levels.description: Write efficient SQL for massive, distributed datasets.

levels.title: Scaling Python with Dask
levels.description: A flexible library for parallel computing in Python.

levels.title: NVIDIA CUDA for Deep Learning
levels.description: A brief introduction to GPU programming for ML.

levels.title: Capstone: Real-world forecasting challenge
levels.description: Compete in a time-series forecasting competition.

levels.title: Capstone: End-to-end NLP project
levels.description: From data collection and annotation to model deployment.

levels.title: Capstone: Building a personalized recommendation engine
levels.description: Design, build, and evaluate a recommendation system.
